ETIA.AFS.oos module

class OOS[source]

Bases: object

Out-of-sample protocols for data splitting.

data_split(oos_protocol, X, y=None, target_type='continuous')[source]

Splits the data according to the specified out-of-sample protocol.

data_split(oos_protocol: Dict[str, Any], X: Any, y: Optional[Any] = None, target_type: str = 'continuous') → Tuple[List[ndarray], List[ndarray]][source]

Splits the data according to the specified out-of-sample protocol.

Parameters:

  • oos_protocol (dict) – Information about the out-of-sample protocol.

  • X (array-like) – The feature data.

  • y (array-like, optional) – The target vector in case of categorical target (for stratified k-fold).

  • target_type (str) – ‘continuous’ or ‘categorical’.

Returns:

  • train_inds (list of np.ndarray) – The training indices for each fold.

  • test_inds (list of np.ndarray) – The testing indices for each fold.
